intro: Manisuris acuminata var. stocksii, commonly known as the slender manisuris, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
